Thanks Colin and Ken! I will look at more advanced RL problem in that case.=

In the link from SharpNEAT you have pretty huge populations (600
individua=
ls / 40 species), is this also standard in NEAT? I was already a
bit taken =
aback to see pole balancing done with 150 individuals. I
understand that yo=
u need larger population sizes for speciation to work,
but is this typical?=


adam

On Fri, Nov 3, 2017 at 8:32 AM, kstanley@... [neat] <
nea=
t@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

>
>
> I entirely agree with what Colin said here=
 - pole balancing is a good test
> that an implementation works, while some=
thing newer is probably better for
> benchmarking.
>
> I do believe the RL =
community appreciates the OpenAI gym, so it's not a
> bad place to try thin=
gs.
>
> 
>

--001a114b3c047cf8fd055d4c8985
Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

345488785ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>I entirely agree with what Coli=
n said here - pole balancing is a good test that an implementation works, w=
hile something newer is probably better for benchmarking.</p><div><br></div=
><div>I do believe the RL community appreciates the OpenAI gym, so it's=
 not a bad place to try things.</div><p></p>

    </div>
